intro: Armeria pubinervis, commonly known as the hairy nervegrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces upright flowering stems that bear clusters of white or pinkish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Armeria pubinervis is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
